import MethodEndpoint from "@theme/ApiExplorer/MethodEndpoint";
import ParamsDetails from "@theme/ParamsDetails";

<Heading
  as={"h1"}
  className={"openapi__heading"}
  children={"List site workflows across all products"}
>
</Heading>

<MethodEndpoint
  method={"get"}
  path={"/api/v1.0/workflows/allproducts/site/{siteId}"}
  context={"endpoint"}
>
  
</MethodEndpoint>



Returns the workflows configured for every licensed product at the specified site. Use this endpoint when you need the workflow UUID and initial step for routing new tickets or validating product availability.

**Note**: This endpoint is part of API version 1.0 which is marked as deprecated.

**Authentication**: Allows anonymous access and app authorization.

**Prerequisites**:
1. **siteId** - Call [GET /api/v1.0/sites/\{siteUrl\}](/docs/api/sites/get-site-by-url) with the district hostname and extract `Item.SiteId`.

**Workflow Example**:
1. Look up the site: [GET /api/v1.0/sites/\{siteUrl\}](/docs/api/sites/get-site-by-url) → store `Item.SiteId`.
2. List workflows: [GET /api/v1.0/workflows/allproducts/site/\{siteId\}](/docs/api/workflows/list-site-product-workflows) → review `Items[]` for each product.
3. When creating tickets, pair the desired `ProductId` with its `WorkflowId` and `InitialStepId`.

<Heading
  id={"request"}
  as={"h2"}
  className={"openapi-tabs__heading"}
  children={"Request"}
>
</Heading>

<ParamsDetails
  parameters={[{"name":"siteId","in":"path","required":true,"description":"UUID of the site whose product workflows should be returned. Obtain by calling GET /api/v1.0/sites/{siteUrl} and reading `Item.SiteId` from the response.","example":"22222222-3333-4444-5555-666666666666","x-obtained-from":{"operationId":"getSiteByUrl","endpoint":"GET /api/v1.0/sites/{siteUrl}","responseField":"Item.SiteId"},"schema":{"type":"string","format":"uuid"}}]}
>
  
</ParamsDetails>

<RequestSchema
  title={"Body"}
  body={undefined}
>
  
</RequestSchema>
